dialog: She announced that the scribe of the literary commentary would soon be departing on a maternity leave, and that I might take up the quill until her return.
Wow! That is indeed news to be celebrated. How often does the periodical see print?
It's a monthly publication, yet I must share the space with another scribe, so I must pen my articles bi-weekly.
Are you eager to delve deeper into the editing work?
Indeed, but my excitement is greater still at the prospect of having my musings published once more!
Do you have any parchment to order a subscription to the magazine?
Alas, I do not, but I believe I might be able to bring a complimentary copy home for you.
I eagerly anticipate reading your commentary.
As do I. Shall we go out to celebrate this good news?
Of course, where might you suggest we go?
Perhaps we could attend the library festival that is being held at the local bookseller's?
Have you seen the new issue of Cosmo that I perused this morn?
I believe I did spy it upon the kitchen table.
Indeed, my thanks. There is an intriguing interview with a prominent director regarding his latest motion picture that I must finish reading.
And who is this director?
It is none other than Martin Scorsese. Did you not enjoy his film, 'The Departed'?
I did, it was grand! Might I read the interview when you have finished?
Of course. You know, it is also available in the online edition. If you are eager to read it now, you might peruse it there.
That is kind, but I shall wait. Out of curiosity, do you subscribe to this periodical?
No, I do not. I do not frequent it enough for a subscription to be justified.
